thread.title: Neymar hangs out with Lewis Hamilton in London as he looks to forget Champions League woes
thread.title_full: Neymar hangs out with Lewis Hamilton in London as he looks to forget Champions League woes

author: Rory Brigstock-Barron
title: Neymar hangs out with Lewis Hamilton in London as he looks to forget Champions League woes
text:
Neymar hangs out with Lewis Hamilton in London as he looks to forget Champions League woes The Brazilian forward was part of the Barcelona team that lost 4-0 to Paris Saint-Germain last week. Share Neymar and Lewis Hamilton hang out in London (Photo: Neymar / Instagram) Share Get FC Barcelona   Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
It was a tale of two cities for Neymar this week as he lived it up in London seven days after Barcelona 's 4-0 hammering by Paris Saint-Germain in the French capital. 
The Brazilian was out and about with F1 star Lewis Hamilton as he enjoyed his week off before jetting back to Spain to prepare for Barcelona's crunch clash with Atletico Madrid on Sunday. 
The 25-year-old played 90 minutes at the Nou Camp on Sunday as Luis Enrique's side needed a 90th-minute Lionel Messi penalty to get past relegation-threatened Leganes. Neymar and his friend enjoy themselves as a London bus passes in the background (Photo: Gilmar Araujo Lima Ferreira / Instagram) Read More Neymar to stand trial on corruption charges over irregularities in move from Santos 
They'll need to improve drastically against Atletico, and the brief holiday could be exactly what Neymar needs as Barca look to keep pressure on leaders Real Madrid in La Liga. 
As well as hanging out with Hamilton, Neymar also posted a picture of himself and a friend busting a move as a London bus passed in the background. The Brazilian played 90 minutes in Barcelona's narrow 2-1 victory over Leganes (Photo: REUTERS) The Catalan giants were thrashed 4-0 by Paris Saint-Germain last week (Photo: AFP) 
Hamilton meanwhile is gearing up for the new Formula 1 season, as he looks to get back on top after being beaten to the Championship by Nico Rosberg last time out. 
The first race of the 2017 campaign takes place in Melbourne in a month's time. poll loading Will Barcelona beat Atletico Madrid on Sunday? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
